subject: Medicine
title: How Placebos Are Used in Trials
description: A micro-lesson that makes How Placebos Are Used in Trials usable.

hook.text: Every new drug must prove it works better than nothing.

buildup.text: Clinical trials give some patients the real drug and others a placebo.

discovery.text: Neither patients nor doctors know who got which one.

twist.text: This double-blind design prevents bias from skewing results.

climax.text: Only drugs that beat the placebo get approved for use.

punchline.text: Every drug must outsmart a sugar pill.

quiz.question: What is a double-blind clinical trial?
options: Neither patients nor doctors know who got the placebo
Only patients are unaware of their treatment
Doctors choose who receives the drug
